## DurableContext.map() method

Processes an array of items, applying durable operations to each with optional concurrency control

**Signature:**

```typescript
map<TInput, TOutput>(items: TInput[], mapFunc: MapFunc<TInput, TOutput, TLogger>, config?: MapConfig<TInput, TOutput>): DurablePromise<BatchResult<TOutput>>;
```

</td><td>

TInput\[\]

</td><td>

Array of items to process

</td><td>

[MapFunc](./durable-execution-sdk-js.mapfunc.md)<!-- -->&lt;TInput, TOutput, TLogger&gt;

</td><td>

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

config

</td><td>

[MapConfig](./durable-execution-sdk-js.mapconfig.md)<!-- -->&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional configuration for concurrency and completion behavior

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[DurablePromise](./durable-execution-sdk-js.durablepromise.md)<!-- -->&lt;[BatchResult](./durable-execution-sdk-js.batchresult.md)<!-- -->&lt;TOutput&gt;&gt;

## Example

```typescript
const results = await context.map(
  [1, 2, 3],
  async (ctx, item, index) => item * 2,
);
```
